Plane

Plane: { normal: math.vec.Vector3; point: math.vec.Vector3 }
brief

The definition of a plane in 3D

Type declaration

  • normal: math.vec.Vector3
  • point: math.vec.Vector3

Functions

distanceFromPointToPlane

  • distanceFromPointToPlane(pt: math.vec.Vector3 | Serie, plane: Plane): number | Serie
  • brief

    Get the distances from 3D points to a plane

    Parameters

    • pt: math.vec.Vector3 | Serie

      The considered 3D points or one point

    • plane: Plane

      The plane defined with a point and its normal

    Returns number | Serie

fittingPlane

  • fittingPlane(points: Serie): Plane
  • brief

    Plane fitting to many 3D points

    Parameters

    • points: Serie

      The points coordinates in flat array

    Returns Plane

    The plane parameters fitting the points in a least squares sens

generateEllipse

  • generateEllipse(__namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; density?: number; nbRings?: number }): DataFrame

  • Generate a meshed ellipse made of nbRings rings. The number of points in a ring is function of the number of rings: nbNodes = ringIndex * density, with ringIndex starting from 1 and ending at nbRings.

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; density?: number; nbRings?: number }
      • a: number

        The x axis length

      • b: number

        The y axis length

      • Optional center?: number[]

        The position of the ellipse center

      • Optional density?: number
      • Optional nbRings?: number

        The number of internal rings (default 8)

    Returns DataFrame

generateRectangle

  • generateRectangle(__namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; na: number; nb: number }): DataFrame

  • Generate a meshed rectangle

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { a: number; b: number; center?: number[]; na: number; nb: number }
      • a: number

        The x axis length

      • b: number

        The y axis length

      • Optional center?: number[]

        The position of the rectangle center

      • na: number

        The number of points along the x axis

      • nb: number

        The number of points along the y axis

    Returns DataFrame

generateSphere

  • generateSphere(subdivision: number): { indices: IArray; positions: IArray }

  • Return two typed array for the faces and the vertices making a sphere given by a subdivision. Note that all triangles are decoupled.

    {
     position: Float32Array,
     indices : Int16Array
}
    example
    import { sphere } from '@youwol/geometry
const {positions, indices} = generateSphere(10)

    Parameters

    • subdivision: number

      The number of subdivision (>0)

    Returns { indices: IArray; positions: IArray }

    • indices: IArray
    • positions: IArray

inflateBBox

  • inflateBBox(bbox: BBox, flat_factor?: number): void

  • Parameters

    • bbox: BBox
    • flat_factor: number = 1.E-02

    Returns void

project

  • project(p: math.vec.Vector3 | Serie, plane: Plane): number[] | Serie<IArray>

  • Project a 3D vector onto the plane and get the in-plane coordinates (2D)

    Parameters

    • p: math.vec.Vector3 | Serie

      The point to project

    • plane: Plane

      The plane

    Returns number[] | Serie<IArray>

    coordinates

simplify

  • simplify(points: Serie, tolerance?: number, highestQuality?: boolean): Serie<IArray>

  • From Simplify.js, a high-performance JS polyline simplification library.

    Polyline simplification dramatically reduces the number of points in a polyline while retaining its shape, giving a huge performance boost when processing it and also reducing visual noise. For example, it's essential when rendering a 70k-points line chart or a map route in the browser using Canvas or SVG.

    github

    mourner.github.io/simplify-js

    copyright

    2013, Vladimir Agafonkin

    license

    BSD-2-Clause "Simplified" License

    Parameters

    • points: Serie

      Can be either 2D or 3D points defined in a Serie

    • tolerance: number = 1
    • highestQuality: boolean = false

    Returns Serie<IArray>

triangulate

  • triangulate(positions: Serie, normal?: vec.Vector3): DataFrame

  • Unconstrained Delaunay triangulation in 2D.

    license

    ISC

    copyright

    2017, Mapbox

    github

    This link

    Parameters

    • positions: Serie
    • normal: vec.Vector3 = ...

      The normal to project th epoint to perform the triangulation

    Returns DataFrame
